ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer

Class OdometryCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.OdometryCorrection

  • public class OdometryCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows the robot to correct itself by using the two rear sensors. When either sensor detects a perpendicular line on the path of the robot, that side's motor stops until the other sensor also detects the line, effectively straightening the robot.
    Author:
    Bijan Sadeghi, Esa Khan

    • Constructor Detail

      • OdometryCorrection

        public OdometryCorrection(double TILE_SIZE,
                          double SENSOR_DIST,
                          RobotController rc,
                          LightSensorController leftLsCont,
                          LightSensorController rightLsCont)
        Parameters:
        TILE_SIZE - the size of a tile
        SENSOR_DIST - the vertical offset of the rear sensors from the robot's center
        rc - the robot controller to use
        leftLsCont - the light sensor controller to use to get data from the left rear sensor
        rightLsCont - the light sensor controller to use to get data from the right rear sensor

    • Method Detail

      • correct

        public void correct(double corrTheta,
                    double[] initialOdo)
        Moves the robot forward until a perpendicular line is detected by one of the sensors. Re-aligns the robot so that both sensors are on the line. Corrects the Odometer's theta and either the x or the y, based on which axis the robot is traveling on.
        Parameters:
        corrTheta - the angle the Odometer must be set to after correction
        initialOdo - the Odometer values from the end of the last correction

      • setIdentifyingBlock

        public void setIdentifyingBlock(boolean identifyingBlock)
        Set the identifyingBlock boolean
        Parameters:
        identifyingBlock -
